intro: Euclea sekhukhuniensis, commonly known as the Khuzi plant, is a flowering shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and is often found in rocky and sandy soils. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance. Euclea sekhukhuniensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
